message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about vehicle efficiency and petrol consumption. As vehicles become more efficient, petrol consumption decreases. This is because efficient vehicles require less fuel to operate and can travel longer distances on a single tank of petrol. Option (A) is incorrect because increased efficiency leads to decreased petrol consumption. Option (B) is incorrect because vehicles still require petrol to function. Option (D) is incorrect because efficiency and petrol consumption are inversely related.

This question requires an understanding of the relationship between vehicle efficiency and petrol consumption. As vehicles become more efficient, they require less petrol to operate, resulting in a decrease in petrol consumption. Option (A) is incorrect because increasing efficiency would lead to a decrease in petrol consumption, not an increase. Option (B) is incorrect because if vehicles become more efficient, they would continue to consume petrol, just at a lower rate. Option (D) is incorrect because increasing efficiency would not cause petrol consumption to remain the same.

Option (D) is incorrect because, as discussed, petrol consumption decreases with increased efficiency.
